member.summary: returns true if the line is a form element, false if not

member.summary: returns true if the line is text, false if it is a link or form element or similar: used by mnuViewCroppage

member.summary: strip out link content from the page, hopefully leaving only main content: may trim out link content occuring as part of main content, but should remove all the navigation info

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.CropOriginalPage
member.summary: 'crops the original text page according to the pre-3.2 mechanisms. This supports pages with lots of IFRAMES and other contructs that prevent me reparsing the page

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.UpdateMenus

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.SelectCurrentParagraph
member.summary: Selects the current paragraph: call this after SkipLinks or similar to give a visual representation of where we're up to.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.SetupTabs

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.IdentifyHeadings(mshtml.IHTMLElement@)

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.FindInputElement(mshtml.IHTMLElement@)
member.summary: Returns the element that is a child of e (or e itself) that is an input/form element, or Nothing if not found.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.txtText_KeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Allow users to follow a particular link by number

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.UserPressedReturn
member.summary: This handles user interaction with the txtText area - in other words, txtText_KeyPress.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.DoDelayedRefresh
member.summary: Call this to turn on a delayed refresh of the display: that is, it'll use a time to wait a bit then do a screen refresh UNLESS a page navigation has commenced in the meantime.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.IsValidEmail(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Takes a proposed email address and does some simple checks that it is valid, returning true/false and an informative error message. Does NOT comply with the appropriate RFC.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMain.tmrDelayLoadBookmarks_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Starts off the "load the bookmarks and populate the bookmarks menu" process, which is really slow because of all the menu work. So start the timer after loading so the program starts faster and THEN loads in all the bookmark menu.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.frmMain.mTeamViewerPath
member.summary: Used in mnuHelpTeamviewer_Click to store where TeamViewerQS.exe will be saved to (so when it has downloaded it can be run.)

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMediaControl.AllSrcAttributesAreData(System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement)
member.summary: If the current audio of video element and its source children are all data elements, return false.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmMediaControl.btnOpen_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Launch the media content in the machine's default player.

member.name: T:WebbIE4.frmWeb
member.summary: Hosts the WebBrowser object and handles detection of page navigation.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.frmWeb._mObjWind
member.summary: 1 For suppressing JavaScript errors. http://support.microsoft.com/?kbid=279535. 2 For detecting the end of navigation.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.frmWeb.mObjEvent
member.summary: Used to trap and hide JavaScript errors.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.frmWeb.mFallbackToDocumentComplete
member.summary: If set, then when webMain fires DocumentComplete, process the page. It's better to rely on mObjEvent, but that fails sometimes - I don't know why, and it might be an artifact of running in the debugger.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmWeb.webMain_Navigated(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserNavigatedEventArgs)
member.summary: "Occurs when the WebBrowser control has navigated to a new document and has begun loading it." This function tries to identify when a navigation starts and capture the necessary references so that I tell get when the Javascript onLoad event fires, not just when the WebBrowser object finishes navigating. This allows for better Javascript support. If something goes wrong then set mFallbackToDocumentComplete to true and get out.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmWeb.mObjWind_onload
member.summary: The first of two mechanisms for detecting the end of navigation, meaning we should call frmMain.ProcessAfterLoad(). Based on the JavaScript onload event.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmWeb.webMain_Navigating(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs)
member.summary: This fires when navigation commences, and fires for each frame or page. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.forms.webbrowser.navigating(v=vs.110).aspx
member.remarks: It does (did) lots of stuff in WebbIE 3, like handling internal links. But this is all buggy and hard, so I'm trying to fix it by simplifying.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmWeb.tmrCheckForEscape_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is a fall-back because some web pages - e.g. YouTube, so probably pages with Flash - will grab the key input and won't let the form get the keypress. So use the Windows API to check for the key and close the window if Escape is pressed.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.frmWeb.tmrCheckForNavigationComplete_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: If the browser has finished navigating, but we have urls we haven't processed, then fire off processing.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modAccesskeys.AddAccessKey(mshtml.IHTMLAnchorElement@)
member.summary: Adds an access key to the current collection.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modAccesskeys.GetURL(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the url for an access key, if any. Case insensitive.

member.summary: Returns the number of lines in the control.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modAPIFunctions.GetCharacterIndexOfLine(System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox@,System.Int32@)

member.summary: Calls SaveString with 4 parameters.

member.summary: Find any label elements in the page and populate the dictionary

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modFormLabelHandler.GetDescriptiveText(mshtml.IHTMLElement@)
member.summary: Returns the descriptive text for a control.
member.remarks: Strictly, this should only use the id for a control. But, of course, people won't code pages like that, so fall back to the name if no id. returns empty string if not found

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gShowFormsOnly
member.summary: indicates that only form contents should be parsed and shown.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gForceNavigation
member.summary: 3.7.4. Set this to true when a user action has occurred (e.g. a form submit) that MUST result in a page navigation even though the resultant href indicates that this is a intra-page (#) link. Try submitting a comment to MetaFilter: the target is .....php/#comment which looks like an internal link.

member.name: T:WebbIE4.modGlobals.PageLoadStrategies
member.summary: How we try to work out if the page has loaded.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.PageLoadStrategies.UseJavaScriptOnLoad
member.summary: Try to use the JavaScript onload event to detect page loading.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.PageLoadStrategies.UseDocumentCompleteOnly
member.summary: Use DocumentComplete event to detect page loading.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gUseJavascriptForPageLoad
member.summary: If True, use JavaScript to work out when a page has loaded. If False, use DocumentComplete. This is because I think the former results in security problems and the latter in pages with rubbish on them.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gNoPageActionSoRefresh
member.summary: If set, then the user has done something that should result in a change to the page - like clicking a Submit button. Sometimes, however, this doesn't actually trigger a page navigation. If this is the case then you have to do a refresh instead.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gClosing
member.summary: Set when we are closing.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gWebHost
member.summary: The main Windows Form hosting the WebBrowser that does all the work.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gDisplayingYoutube
member.summary: The only time that frmWeb is allowed to get focus is when we are trying to get a Youtube video to start by clicking on it.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gRSSFeedURL
member.summary: 'the url of the current web page's RSS feed, or "" if there is none.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gExiting
member.summary: indicates we're quitting the application and event-based stuff we might have started should terminate. Primarily the WinInet control. TODO What about gClosing?

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.NUMBER_CHARS_ALLOWED_BETWEEN_LINKS
member.summary: The number of characters allowed between links if they are to stay on the same line.

member.summary: Indicates whether the form with the WebBrowser control should be visible (requested by the user)

member.summary: Indicates that the focus should be put back on frmMain.

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modGlobals.gDesiredURL

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modHTTPGetter.GetFile(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: gets the file determined by url, saves it to path

member.name: F:WebbIE4.modI18N._applicationXML
member.summary: Internationalisation for VB.Net projects using XML files
member.remarks: HOW TO USE 1 Create ASSEMBLYNAME.Language.Xml (e.g. WebbIE4.Language.Xml) file in same folder as program. 2 Copy in Common.Language.Xml to same folder. 3 Amend as required. 4 When debugging call SetDebug() to output a list of incomplete translations to the desktop.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modI18N.DoControl(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.String)
member.summary: DoControl translates a control AND its children - usually the .Text value, but the .AccessibleName if there is one.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modI18N.GetText(System.String@)
member.summary: Returns the internationalised version of the string provided according to the current language (and the availability of the translation.)
member.remarks: If there is no "item" node in AssemblyName.Language.xml that has a "key" node containing the argument text then the argument text is returned. This means that if the code calls GetText("Hello world") and no translation is provided then then function will return "Hello world". On the assumption that calling code is English there is therefore an implicit English default. If the "item" node that matches the argument text has a "leaveBlank" child then the empty string is returned.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modParseA.TrivialParse(mshtml.IHTMLElement)
member.summary: Parse the element and return the text contents. This is used instead of .innerText because it adds in a space between child text elements, which might produce extra spaces but means things like Facebook look okay when parsed - otherwise you get "0REquests" and "3Messages" and suchlike. Alasdair, June 2013.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modScriptErrors.RestoreScriptErrors
member.summary: Restore script error settings to what they were when DisableScriptErrors was called.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.modSounds.PlayProgressSound(System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays the progress sound.

member.name: M:WebbIE4.NativeMethods.GetKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to work out if a key is pressed or not.

member.name: T:WebbIE4.WebBrowserUtility
member.summary: Helper functions for using the Microsoft WebBrowser control

member.name: T:WebbIE4.WebBrowserUtility.InternetExplorerEmulationMode
member.summary: Values for FEATURE_BROWSER_EMULATION

member.name: M:WebbIE4.WebBrowserUtility.SetWebBrowserEmulation(WebbIE4.WebBrowserUtility.InternetExplorerEmulationMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key necessary for any WebBrowser components used in this project to emulate a particular version of Internet Explorer. If you don't do this then any WebBrowser objects will run as IE7. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee330730(v=VS.85).aspx http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee330730%28VS.85%29.aspx#browser_emulation http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4612255/regarding-ie9-webbrowser-control
member.param: The IE mode you want. Note that "best" is "best at the time this code is written". So in January 2014 "best" is "IE11". When IE12 comes out, if this code hasn't been updated, then, you'll not get the latest IE.

If true then your IE mode will be applied, even if you are using a version of Windows that was not extant when the code was written and the logic has therefore not been checked. You probably want this.
